intro: Bidens menziesii subsp. menziesii, commonly known as the Mexican tickseed, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom from summer to fall. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry prairies and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for pollinators and a popular choice in native plant gardens.
